result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Arthur Larsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert Arthur Larsen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert Arthur Larsen was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DNA surcharge.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Robert Arthur Larsen
Current: 1525 127th St, New Richmond, WI 54017 United States  (Effective: 03-27-2019)
Prior: 122 Court St N #2, Prescott, WI 54021-1510 United States
From DE in writing per PPA.  jaf
DE appeared.  DE to pay $40/mo comm 4-28-19.  $15 PPF added.  DE signed PPA. Includes 16CM109, 17CF465. jaf

03:18 PM   CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, ADA:  Megan E. Kelly, DF ATTY:  Julie A. Weber, DF:  Robert Arthur Larsen appeared. Includes Pleas on 17CF465 and PAYH on 16CM109. Plea questionairre is filed with the Court. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads guilty to Ct 1 in 2017CF465. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 2017CF465. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Cts 2 & 3 in 2017CF465. Sentencing arguments. 
Crt orders: 5 years probation with conditions: 
- 360 days in St. Croix county jail - 25 days credit with Good Time - 60 days STAYED
- Huber is granted for work, seek work and treatment
- 24 month license revocation
- 24 month Ignition Interlock Device
- $133.50 in Blood Draw costs to SCSO
- $1053.00 fine, inclusive 
-  DNA surcharge of $250.00 
- Submit DNA sample
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
- Random testing at the discretion of Agent
- AODA and complete all follow through
- Complete all programming necessary as deemed necessary by COMPASS or probation

Report to probation by Tuesday, January 22 at 4:00 pm 

Defendant to meet with payment clerk and is approved to delay the start of payments until release. 

Defendant advised of right to appeal.

CO: RMW , REP: Drost, CLERK: Webb, ADA: Megan E. Kelly, DF ATTY: Julie A. Weber   DF:  Robert Arthur Larsen appeared.  Court called.  Includes case 16CM109 & 17CF465.  DE has provided the State with medical records and due to the DE's current condition Crt will continue the FPT/Plea/Sentencing out and the payment hearing on 16CM109.   Court removes the Jury Trial.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2018 at 02:30 pm.
Payment hearing on October 26, 2018 at 03:30 pm.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 16CM109 (PAYH) and 17CF465 (PTC):
CO: RMW , REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Julie A. Weber   DF:  Robert Arthur Larsen appeared. Case called at 8:36 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a pre trial conference. Atty Weber states that an offer has been extended. State is recommending a PSI. Court can not Order a PSI without a conviction. Atty Weber states DE is currently in aftercare. Has completed treatment. Court will refer parties to schedule with JA for the plea hearing and the trial date. Address confirmed. Bond continues.
Payment hearing on April 4, 2018 at 10:30 am.

Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Tape, Clerk: Benoy  3:01   ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Julie A. Weber   DF:  Robert Arthur Larsen appeared via phone.  INCLUDES:  ARGN on 17CF465 & Pymt hearing on 16CM109.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Mr Larsen's expected release date is in March.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 4, 2018 at 10:30 am.

Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Tape, Clerk: Rohan. ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Julie A. Weber   DF:  Robert Arthur Larsen appeared from jail. Case called at 8:33 am. CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Eric Gordon Johnson, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Robert Arthur Larsen appeared.  Court called at 10:00 a.m.  Set for a PTC.  There is an agreement.   Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1.  Crt reviews the police reports. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses Ct 2. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: 

- Court costs of $443.00 
- DE to meet with the payment clerk for a payment plan
-20 days to appeal
From Hudson Hospital & Clinic. Re: treatment of Def. km

Continue the PTC.  Verified the DEs address.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 3:18 p.m. lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Filed by ADA McKinley. km
Notice of Motio to Suppress Statements and Motion to Suppress Evidence filed by Atty. A. Andrea. gme
Atty. A. Andrea. gme
Pre-trial conference at 04-04-2016 03:00 pm

NO CONTACT with Richard Larsen until the 72 hour is lifted - Monday February 15, 2016.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Richard L.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley,  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea,  DF:  Robert Arthur Larsen appeared from jail. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
